01_data_basics/01_counting/05_read_frequency_distribution_v1

A random procedure generated 80 measurements, which were organized into the frequency distribution shown below. You can assume the measurements are of a continuous random variable, such that every measurement is in one of the intervals (and not on a break).

interval frequency
50 — 50.5 8
50.5 — 51 5
51 — 51.5 13
51.5 — 52 10
52 — 52.5 6
52.5 — 53 12
53 — 53.5 7
53.5 — 54 10
54 — 54.5 4
54.5 — 55 5

  1. Evaluate \(\#[\mathbf{x}<51]\).
  2. Evaluate \(\#[\mathbf{x}>51.5]\).
  3. Evaluate \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-52.25|<0.75]\).
  4. Evaluate \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-53.25|>0.25]\).
  5. Find boundary \(b\) such that \(\#[\mathbf{x}<b] = 36\).
  6. Find boundary \(b\) such that \(\#[\mathbf{x}>b] = 54\).
  7. Find radius \(r\) such that \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-52.5|<r] = 67\).
  8. Find radius \(r\) such that \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-52.5|>r] = 22\).
